items.title: Relief for employers: New labour codes slash jail provisions to 22

While the second half may see a slight moderation, domestic demand remains robust. ICICI projects 7.0 percent growth for FY26 and 6.5 percent for FY27, indicating a positive economic outlook.

items.title: Can GDP ‘nowcasts’ help a data-strapped RBI formulate monetary policy? It’s worth a try
items.summary: India’s GDP figures arrive with long lags and frequent revisions, while monetary policy needs to be forward-looking. Could ‘nowcasting’ based on a wide range of early indicators offer a solution? A closer look reveals promise, complexity and a crucial caveat.

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 26th November 2025: Sensex jumps 1,022.50 points; Nifty inches near record high on US fed rate cut hopes
items.summary:
Snapping the three-day falling streak, benchmark Sensex rebounded by 1,022 points while Nifty reclaimed the 26,000 level on Wednesday on across-the-board buying aided by a rally in global peers amid growing hopes of a US Fed rate cut and fresh foreign fund inflows.

The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 1,022.50 points or 1.21 per cent to settle at 85,609.51. During the day, it surged 1,057.18 points or 1.24 per cent to 85,644.19.

The 50-share NSE Nifty zoomed 320.50 points or 1.24 per cent to end at 26,205.30, just 10 points shy of its all time high.

In intra-day trade, Nifty rallied 330.35 points

items.title: M&A activity robust, value jumps 37% in first 9 months
items.summary: Indian companies are actively engaged in mergers and acquisitions. Deal values rose significantly in the first nine months of 2025. This surge highlights strong investor confidence. Key sectors saw substantial transactions. A major Gulf investment in Indian private banking marks a milestone. This trend signals India's growing prominence in global M&A.

items.title: EPFO sets up panel for cadre restructuring
items.summary: To address the current challenges within its organizational setup, the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation has assembled a four-member committee, under the guidance of BP Sharma. This committee will evaluate the existing employee structure, uncover operational inefficiencies, and put forth suggestions to elevate both efficiency and customer service. Furthermore, the panel will explore frameworks for the reassignment of officers and staff.

items.title: ADB approves $400 million for climate-resilient roads in Maharashtra
items.summary: The Asian Development Bank has approved a $400 million results-based lending program for Maharashtra to develop climate-resilient, low-carbon, and safe road networks. This initiative will expand all-weather roads in 34 districts, particularly in vulnerable regions, connecting rural communities to essential services and markets. The program also emphasizes road safety, climate resilience, and gender equality, benefiting over 1.7 million people.

items.title: Finance ministry tells banks to fast-track IBC cases, CEOs asked to personally monitor top pending resolutions
items.summary: The finance ministry has urged banks to adopt a strategic approach to bolster the IBC ecosystem for enhanced value and recoveries. State-run bank CEOs are now tasked with personally monitoring top pending insolvency cases and those awaiting resolution at the NCLT, emphasizing strict adherence to timelines.

items.title: Sitharaman pushes for streamlined corporate governance, directs MCA to build real-time transparency dashboard
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized simplifying processes and making systems user-friendly for easy and transparent governance. She directed the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) to modernize systems for timely stakeholder service and build a live dashboard for enhanced transparency. Discussions covered various operational aspects to improve ease of doing business.

items.title: As anti-Maoist push nears final phase, Chhattisgarh shifts Bastar strategy to tourism and small industries
items.summary: Chhattisgarh government is promoting smaller industries, tourism, and agro-based businesses in Bastar, focusing on tribal welfare and avoiding displacement.  With declining Maoist violence and improved connectivity, the region is attracting significant investment, aiming for a turnaround through sustainable development and hospitality projects.

items.title: Centre halts fresh Jal Jeevan Mission funds until states act on widespread corruption findings
items.summary: The Centre is tightening its grip on the Jal Jeevan Mission, halting fund releases until states address corruption and irregularities. Following a high-level review and deployment of nodal officers, action has been taken against hundreds of officials and contractors, with FIRs lodged in several states. A scheme-based funding model will replace lump sums to ensure accountability.

items.title: Labour codes to benefit workers, reduce and simplify compliances: Union Labour Secretary Vandana Gurnani
items.summary: The new Labour Codes in India are a game changer for workforce welfare. Workers can look forward to improved wages, enhanced social security, and reinforced safety standards. Anticipation builds as the government prepares to unveil feedback mechanisms soon. This overhaul is strategically aimed at stimulating investments and job creation. Additionally, fixed-term employment is now safeguarded, offering vital protections.

items.title: Exports in positive zone; SEZ surplus can help cut imports, says Piyush Goyal

Merchandise exports are on an upward trajectory compared to last year. Discussions are ongoing to boost competitiveness in Special Economic Zones. This surplus capacity can help reduce imports from countries like ASEAN and China.

items.title: India races to shield exporters as US tariffs bite: Major scheme guidelines set to be released soon
items.summary: India is set to issue clearer rules for its key export schemes next week. The Rs 25,060 crore Export Promotion Mission aims to strengthen outbound shipments, with detailed guidelines for the Interest Equalisation Scheme and the Market Access Initiative expected shortly. The move is designed to support Indian exporters as they navigate growing challenges, particularly those arising from the recent tariff increases imposed by the United States.
